document.docTitle: Campodorus albilineatus Sheng, Sun & Li 2020, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The species of Campodorus Förster, 1869 and a related species (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The species of Campodorus Förster, 1869 and a related species (Hymenoptera, Ichneumonidae) from China

figureCitation.captionText-0: Figs 1–3. Campodorus albilineatus Sheng, Sun & Li sp. nov., holotype, ♀ (GSFGPM). 1. Habitus, lateral view. 2. Head, anterior view. 3. Head, lateral view.
figureCitation.captionText-1: Figs 4–7. Campodorus albilineatus Sheng, Sun & Li sp. nov., holotype, ♀ (GSFGPM). 4. Head, dorsal view. 5. Mesoscutum. 6. Mesosoma, lateral view. 7. Propodeum.
figureCitation.captionText-2: Figs 8–10. Campodorus albilineatus Sheng, Sun & Li sp. nov., holotype, ♀ (GSFGPM). 8. Metasoma, dorsal view. 9. Tergites 2–3, dorsal view. 10. Apical portion of metasoma, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The new species is similar to
C . ciliatus (Holmgren, 1857)
, but can be distinguished from the latter by the following combination of characters: median longitudinal carinae of propodeum ( Fig. 7 ) almost parallel; ovipositor sheath ( Fig. 10 ) without particularly long setae; hind coxa yellowish white dorsally, brownish red ventrally; posterior margin of metasomal tergites ( Figs 8–10 ) widely white. Hind tibia pale in basal 0.3, blackish at extreme base and in apical half.
Campodorus ciliatus
: median longitudinal carinae of propodeum strongly narrowed medially; apical portion of ovipositor sheath at apex with a few particularly long setae; hind coxa entirely red; metasomal tergites almost entirely black. Hind tibia predominantly pale rufous, not darkened at base, and brownish in apical 0.33.

Another Oriental species,
C . orientalis Kasparyan, 1998
, differs from the new species in having the mesothorax and hind coxa completely red, first flagellomere strongly elongate, 1.9 × as long as second, and areas of the propodeum before the level of the spiracle obliterated.
The specific name is derived from the white bands on the hind margins of the metasomal tergites.

caption.paragraph:
Figs 1–3.
Campodorus albilineatus Sheng, Sun & Li
sp. nov. , holotype, ♀ (GSFGPM). 1 . Habitus, lateral view. 2 . Head, anterior view. 3 . Head, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
CHINA • 5 ♀♀ , 4 ♂♂ ; Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region , Shangsi , Mt Shiwan ;
20–27 Nov. 2018
; interception trap ; GSFGPM
.
MEASUREMENTS. Body length 6.9–8.1 mm . Fore wing length 5.5–6.4 mm . Ovipositor sheath length 0.4– 0.5 mm .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Campodorus albilineatus
sp. nov. is the only species known from the Oriental part of China .
